intro: Chiococca semipilosa, commonly known as the silky chiococca, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
